boardgame.name: Chronicles of Blood: Solo War Game
boardgame.description:
An war game game for just one person - YOU!

The world of Arax is a world filled with blood and battle, magic and monsters, slaughter and sorcery. It is a world where the weak are crushed and the strong survive, where those who are bigger and more powerful bully those who are weaker and more vulnerable. It is a world at war, with armies clashing violently on the fields of battle. A great general is needed to lead these armies, and that general is you!

Chronicles of Blood is a game where you, the reader, takes on the role of an army commander in the world of Arax. It is your job to fight lead your troops to glory, destroying the enemy and either saving or conquering the world, depending on the army you choose.

Arax is a dark and dangerous world and a time of reckoning is approaching. The ancient empires of men, dwarfs and elves are crumbling, beset on all sides by the dark hordes of the orcs, goblins, demons and the undead.

The once magnificent elven forests, at one time beautiful, green and lush, are now withering and dying, the magically-crafted towers and wondrous tree-cities that lie within broken and shattered. Only the elven talent at manipulating mana, the magical force that permeates Arax, has stopped their race from being wiped out.

The dwarven fortresses built high in the mountains of Arax are now overrun with goblins, who burrowed up through the earth and attacked from within the otherwise impenetrable fortress walls. One by one the fortresses fall and, although the dwarven courage and skill with weapons is legendary, even they find themselves overwhelmed by the sheer number of goblins pouring in to their homes.

And humanity find themselves sorely pressed on all sides, their cities and towns constantly raided and besieged. The barbaric orc tribes march down from the north, pillaging everything in their path. The necromantic legions from the southern desert kingdoms shamble forward, unrelenting in their march towards the human lands. Some humans even turn against their own, worshipping demonic powers in secret and plotting the downfall of their race from within.

The final battles that will decide the fate of Arax are fast approaching. Soldiers line up on opposite sides of the battlefield, ready to lay down their lives in service to their commander. Will you lead your troops to ultimate victory, or will you fail in your leadership and suffer humiliating, crushing defeat?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Quik Frik: Rules for Fast-Action Skirmish Combat in Miniatures Wargaming
boardgame.description:
Got a scenario you're dying to try out, but don't want to learn pages of complicated rules?

New to gaming and ready to get your feet wet?

Experienced gamer looking for simple rules with a unique approach?

QUIK FRIK is a one-page rule set (with a bonus page) that offers a unique approach to miniatures skirmish gaming, for scenarios from WWII through sci-fi. These rules emphasize the friction that can mount during combat. They are well suited for small-scale combat, from a handful of figures up to a platoon. They are best for 6-20mm miniatures.

Rules are included for movement and combat, including vehicles. Combat results can be seen with just one roll of the dice on one combat table. A unique activation sequence is also featured. Forces can be regular or elite, and the bonus page offers many special abilities.

With QUIK FRIK, your favorite scenario can be as mindblowing as your favorite movie scene, and it can go almost as fast. So get your game on right now.

boardgame.name: Relic Worlds Showdown: Dark Agents
boardgame.description:
Known by some simply as The Dark Ones, this cult of fanatical authoritarians believe all evidence of past alien civilizations must be destroyed, and those who have been exposed to it must be terminated. (Though they themselves collect the occasional artifact that could help the greater good.)

Relic Worlds Showdown uses the Showdown miniatures rules by Pinnacle Entertainment to recreate skirmish battles in the Relic Worlds universe. In it, players find artifacts and other treasures left behind by long-lost alien civilizations. But the characters must be careful, as these alien races also left behind traps, and fierce monsters remain that will prove a deadly challenge to your faction.

In these pages, you will find rules for turning your Showdown game into a Relic Worlds one, and the faction information for the Dark Agents.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Larfleeze
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

After all of his beloved treasure was destroyed, Larfleeze had fallen into a slump. He was left moping as he and his last remaining ‘possession’, his butler Pulsar Stargrave, slowly drifted towards Creation Point, where they would be reduced to raw energy. Just as Pulsar managed to talk Larfleeze back into action, N’Odens, Laord of the Hunt crossed the barrier, revealing the existence of an entire other universe on the other side. His dimension had been reduced to entropic ruin after eons of constant warfare between living gods, so the few survivors have come here to begin anew. But the survivors are the gods responsible for the sorry state of their home universe in the first place, leading to inevitable chaos when they clash with Agent Orange.

boardgame.name: Modern Naval Conflicts: European Expansion Vol I – France & Germany
boardgame.description:
EUROPE HAS ARRIVED!

This is the first volume of the two-part Euro Expansion for our Modern Naval Conflicts game. This expansion adds the ships, subs, aircraft, helicopters, and SAM systems for France and the Federal Republic of Germany for both the 1970s and 1980s time frame.

Players can now include the forces of France and West Germany in their MNC scenarios or campaigns: all the major surface ships, submarines, combat aircraft, and land-based SAM systems of both nations are included, along with scenarios to help get you started with the action!

This expansion features over 70 complete Unit Data Sheets, including units such as the French carrier Clemenceau, the FRG Class 143A Gepard PTG, the deadly Tornado attack aircraft, and the quiet FRG Type 206A submarine class.
Also included is a brief overview/introduction/notes on both nations forces.

Four scenarios are also included that demonstrate typical situations each nation’s forces may have faced in the European/GIUK theatre.

—description from the publisher
